intro: Daucus gummifer var. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate gumweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically finely divided and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The species is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
